item.title: Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As an Analytics Developer, you will develop our analytics infrastructure to make it more flexible, reliable, and performant. This role requires cooperation, coordination with quant, trading, and IT groups. You possess strong programming and API design skills.

Previous projects with low latency or high throughput analytics, and interest in financial products across asset classes would be preferred, but isn’t necessary.

What will you do? 

  • Refactor and consolidate analytics-related functionality.
  • Design robust API’s around common pieces of functionality, refactoring the code to support these new APIs, retire legacy code, and ensure that structural problems are also addressed during the refactoring.
  • Investigate and fix stability problems, determine what the fundamental solution should be, and prioritize accordingly.
  • Identify and address gaps in test coverage.
  • Interface with vendor systems, expose analytics to Excel and Risk systems.
  • Proposes the design and implementation of strategic analytics API’s.
  • Analyze and fix performance and stability problems in the internal analytics layers.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have:

  • Strong command of C++, Python or Java.
  • Expert in algorithms and data structures, object orientation, design patterns, and functional programming paradigms.
  • Excellent problem solving and quantitative skills.
  • Excellent API design, refactoring, profiling and code optimization skills.
  • Experience as a senior developer or team lead.

Nice to have:

  • Expertise with designing and supporting financial analytics API’s.
  • Experience with databases, distributed cache products, distributed and multithreaded computation, big data processing technologies such as Spark.
  • Experience with multiple platforms (Windows, Linux), compilers and tools for C++ development.
  • Experience with .Net.
  • Experience with build/test/release infrastructure.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-05-02-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-10-28-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​

item.title: Trading Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trading Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Capital Markets Technology, Equities group is seeking a Senior Software Developer to work on a Risk & Execution Services Applications supporting the Equity Derivatives trading desks. The platform stores risk analytics generated by a proprietary valuation engine and makes them available through a variety of interfaces to Traders. The applications also involve saving market data, running reports and analysis to serve the trading desk.

What will you do?

  • Work as a member of a global team to build Technology solutions used across the Equity and Equity Derivatives trading desks (Flow, DLO, STP, CED, CASH).
  • Create UI and interact with user to create the best user experience
  • Work with Capital Market UI Framework (React JS, Javascript, python)
  • Create Data providers to source data from various services (C#, python) to feed the UI
  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable Python, C# data loading, extracts and transformations.
  • Transition existing UIs into the new one
    • Back-End: C#/python – Docker/K8s deployment
    • Front-End: Web Application
  • Create Services and Rest endpoints for application
  • Work with Traders on daily applications and Implement solutions for their asks
  • Check-In code under source control (github/svn)
  • Create Build and Deployment Script (shell) on Jenkins
  • Scripts to source control Git/Docker/K8s

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ Years of Experience in Web Front-End Development (Javascript, React JS)
  • 3+ Years of Experience in Python
  • 3+ Years of OOO Development (Java, C#)
  • Experience with of UI/UX Styling
  • Knowledge of Database (SQL, Indexing, clustering, performance)
  • Knowledge of distributed architectures
  • Knowledge and understanding of Equity Derivatives
  • Experience with DevOps (Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm
  • Experience with REST, RPC, IDL
  • Understanding of Equity Derivatives and Risk frameworks
  • Basic understanding of Equity Derivatives Pricing, Greeks and Risk
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis (time series, linear regression)
  • Ability to adapt and learn new languages and Technology
  • Team work, ability collaboration with other groups/teams

Nice-to-have

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Experience with C#

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, on progressive thinking to keep growing, and on working together to deliver trusted advice to our clients and help communities prosper.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with business stakeholders.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Job Summary

New York, New York, United States of America

USA-NY-NEW YORK

item.title: Manager, Stress Testing Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Stress Testing Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Associate Director, Stress Testing Analytics will implement stress testing components and participate in risk management analytics and processes to minimize credit risk. The ideal candidate will apply extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

What will you do?

  • Develops and maintains tools used for the implementation and execution of credit risk models. These models are used in the measurement of Expected Credit Loss (ECL), Provision for Credit Losses, and RWA for internal and regulatory stress testing.
  • Execute the production of stress testing projections for internal and regulatory filings.
  • Identify ECL production challenges and conducts independent problem solving to resolve proficiently.
  • Communicate results and analyses to management and key stakeholders.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Experience with SAS & Python programming
  • Experience with data analytics
  • Knowledge of credit products in the financial industry

Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with statistical modelling of credit products
  • Experience with stress testing programs in the financial industry

​

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

Monitors market risk and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.title: Manager - Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager - Data Analytics

Job Description

Manager, Data Analytics

What is the opportunity?

As Manager, Data Analytics, you will analyze, design and implement data analytics solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools.  As well assist with the development and execution of data analytics, data visualization and reporting implementation within the internal audit function in support of becoming an insight driven organization.  Work with structured and unstructured data to further enable a risk-based audit approach and help identify impacts to the organization’s internal control environment leveraging automated and self-served capabilities.
 

The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective— with a coordinated view across the entire business—to deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

What will you do?  

  • Data Curation & Statistics: Curate, prepare and wrangle data to test business hypotheses.

  • Technology: Prepare and integrate large and varied datasets and deploy production grade solutions.

  • Domain Knowledge: Collaborate with business partners to produce insights from business-defined requirements and hypotheses.

  • Communication & Visualization: Effectively communicate findings to business partners.  Leverage advanced visualization tools to create powerful representations of results.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong experience working as a Business / Technical Systems Analyst in a highly analytical environment.

  • Expert experience in data analytics cycle (data gathering, transformation, modeling, analytics, and reporting).

  • Strong knowledge and experience with traditional database technology (i.e. SQL) and a fundamental understanding of data flow and handling.

  • Expert coding skills with Python/R.

  • Experience with data visualization libraries (e.g. plotly, ggplot, seaborn, Shiny, Dash).

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

Canada

Full time

item.title: Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will have the opportunity to apply analytics to the point of client interaction with the Digital Products of RBC.  You will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle: data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations. 

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure and complete analyses, uncover insights, develop net new data assets, and build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 5+ years of experience in related digital product development, data analyst or data mining role
  • Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm for advancing digital analytics and products
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala and PowerPoint
  • Experience with Jupyter Notebooks, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Tableau or comparable data visualization tools
  • Hands-on knowledge of agile methodologies Github and JIRA
  • Structured thinking: developing an end-to-end analysis plans to tackle ambiguous and open-ended business problems
  • Stakeholder management skills: ability to inform and influence stakeholders through data, build relationships, communicate early and often
  • High agency: figuring out a way to get the job done, pushing through in the face of imperfect conditions or managing to reverse adverse conditions to achieve goals

Nice-to-have

  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Design, oversee and deliver analytics on client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use data mining and a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights
    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support product development strategies and drive decisions
    • Help implement re-usable analytics frameworks for use across Digital data
  • Data Collection/ Ingestions/ Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
  • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
  • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities
  • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Actively support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Manage stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with progress on deliverables
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Regular

Salaried

item.title: Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Fraud Management (FM) teams employ deep subject matter expertise in identifying, assessing, mitigating and controlling fraud risks for the Enterprise.  Within Fraud Management, the Fraud Data Science & Analytics (FDSA) team develops and optimizes fraud detection strategies to maximize operational effectiveness and minimize client impact. The FDSA Research and Analytics function  conducts analytic research into fraud issues identifying  causation and correlation, develop insights on emerging trends, gaps or systemic issues, and collaborate with Fraud Management partners to communicate results and take action.

Please Note: While the work arrangement for this opportunity is primarily remote, you may be required to periodically attend an approved RBC office location.

What will you do?

  • Identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships from Fraud data and advise FM SMT of emerging trends, specific gaps or systemic issues that impact the Fraud Risk of RBC
  • Collaborate with appropriate partners for action, correction, awareness and training
  • Forecast Financials and Fraud KPI’s using predictive analytics techniques and generate insights for executive decision making and communicating results through insightful visualizations, white papers, reports and presentations
  • Research business problems, develop solutions to support investigation and analysis and lead progression of analytics methodology, tools and measurement to create development templates for automation
  • Build the foundation of information in consolidated data repositories for Operations, Fraud Events, Fraud Performance and Financials
  • Provide a complete picture of the fraud landscape with drill-down capabilities for root cause analysis and deliver self-serve interactive visualizations through accessible platforms like Tableau
  • Conduct Code Reviews and develop standards for Development practices and partner with project teams to support information required for analysis of the current state
  • Deliver Project Reporting for Fraud Events, Performance, Operational and Financial KPI’s and KRI’s and Program Benefits measurements to track success criteria of the Project Business Case

What do you need to succeed?

  • 2+ years’ experience in a Data science and analytics
  • Advanced capability in using Python, R, PySpark, SAS, SQL and Tableau
  • Experience with Databases and Data Structures (RDBMS, Hadoop etc.)
  • Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize and complete projects effectively and in a timely manner
  • Strong team player with a track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team
  • Professional verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and ability to provide consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline driven environment with ambiguity
  • Good understanding of Canadian Financial Institutions, with a focus on Fraud/Risk Operations

Nice-to-have

  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Fair compensation
  • Challenging work in a fast-paced timeline driven work environment
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work with a great and supportive team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Canada

Full time

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Senior Manager HR Data Governance Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager HR Data Governance Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?
RBC, one of Canada’s largest and most respected employers, is looking for an experienced Senior Manager Data Governance Analytics to join our growing Talent Data and Analytics team.

Reporting to the Director, Data Governance & Data Management, the Senior Manager Data Governance Analytics will be a strong execution lead of all facets of HR data management and governance across the HR domain.  You will lead cross-functional projects, where root cause analysis and end-to-end data discovery efforts need to be supplemented with strong stakeholder management to ensure the team provides relevant advice and oversight to our HR Centres of Excellence, business partners and other stakeholders through projects, initiatives, and day to day operational activities related to the management and governance of HR data. 

Your quick, problem-solving ability allows you to investigate, analyze, organize and prioritize easily –and is foundational to your success in the role. You are able to keep the big vision in your mind, with an eye on moving parts of a project and quickly assess impact, pivot as needed and redirect the efforts to bring the project to fruition.  Your strong ability to work with multiple stakeholders and form positive working relationships will also be helpful. You will interface regularly with SMEs from HR Centres of Excellence, the HR Architecture team and the HR Reporting team as well as our partners in IT, Finance, Chief Data Office and Legal.  A key focus for our team and this role in particular is in the proper design of employee data capture processes, to make them more accurate and efficient for employees, managers, and the HR community.

As the right candidate, you are able to make evidence-backed recommendations to senior leadership and influence decisions, drive projects forward in tight deadlines, and navigate the organization effectively.  You are multifaceted self-starter, fast-paced, comfortable with change and ambiguity, and understand how to apply design thinking and problem solving skills to projects. You are excited by opportunities to optimize our HR data architecture, data governance, and data pipelines. You understand how HR data is increasingly seen as an invaluable asset, and are comfortable collaborating with HR subject matter experts to understand the business requirements.

​What will you do?

  • Develop or implement strategies and processes for data implementation, data acquisition, and archive recovery.
  • Work with business, applications and operations counterparts to ensure data integrity and availability.
  • Resolve data integration and security issues for adherence to the organization\'s quality standards.
  • Understand requirements from businesses to help review, improve and document changes to data definitions, access, usage and management processes
  • Translate business requirements to IT requirement
  • Ensures all data captured is defined and documented.
  • Advise on best practices for data usage/security/retention/collection etc. for various projects related to HR data and analytics
  • Engage in a variety of initiatives supporting  HR operations, and strive to evolve the maturity of the HR Data Governance program
  • Work with data infrastructure team, data integration teams etc. to execute on projects
  • Document, manage and execute master data validation strategies for the function
  • Execute analytical audits against a variety of types of HR data to assess data validity and data quality, understand gaps, impact and scope of data issues
  • Collaborate with other departments on data management related projects and reviews.
  • Support an effective governance communication program for the function
  • Build a common repository of HR data knowledge including data dictionaries, dimension and measure definitions, and lineage
  • Summarize and explain data sets and designs, business processes
  • Support the strategic development of the HR Governance Program through research and analytics

What do you need to succeed?

 Must have:

  • 5+ years’ experience in a data-driven environment with a strong understanding of data issues, data management and data governance principles.  
  • Strong business acumen and stakeholder management skills to understand business requirements. 
  • Experience troubleshooting data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Experience designing processes to support data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
  • Extremely strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured and sub-optimized datasets.
  • Strong management and organizational skills
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
  • Communication and presentation skills: ability to summarize and playback analysis, tailor the content for different audiences (technical and non-technical) to drive to impact and help make data-driven decisions.

Nice-to-have

  • HR/People data domain experience is preferred.
  • Graduate degree demonstrating the ability to research, learn and problem solve.
  • Experience in agile development and design thinking methodologies
  • Superior MS Excel and PowerPoint
  • SQL/MySQL or other data query/analytics capability
  • Comfort with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater scopes of work

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?
RBC, one of Canada’s largest and most respected employers, is looking for an experienced Senior Manager Data Governance Analytics to join our growing Talent Data and Analytics team.

Reporting to the Director, Data Governance & Data Management, the Senior Manager Data Governance Analytics will be a strong execution lead of all facets of HR data management and governance across the HR domain.  You will lead cross-functional projects, where root cause analysis and end-to-end data discovery efforts need to be supplemented with strong stakeholder management to ensure the team provides relevant advice and oversight to our HR Centres of Excellence, business partners and other stakeholders through projects, initiatives, and day to day operational activities related to the management and governance of HR data.

Your quick, problem-solving ability allows you to investigate, analyze, organize and prioritize easily –and is foundational to your success in the role. You are able to keep the big vision in your mind, with an eye on moving parts of a project and quickly assess impact, pivot as needed and redirect the efforts to bring the project to fruition.  Your strong ability to work with multiple stakeholders and form positive working relationships will also be helpful. You will interface regularly with SMEs from HR Centres of Excellence, the HR Architecture team and the HR Reporting team as well as our partners in IT, Finance, Chief Data Office and Legal.  A key focus for our team and this role in particular is in the proper design of employee data capture processes, to make them more accurate and efficient for employees, managers, and the HR community.

As the right candidate, you are able to make evidence-backed recommendations to senior leadership and influence decisions, drive projects forward in tight deadlines, and navigate the organization effectively.  You are multifaceted self-starter, fast-paced, comfortable with change and ambiguity, and understand how to apply design thinking and problem solving skills to projects. You are excited by opportunities to optimize our HR data architecture, data governance, and data pipelines. You understand how HR data is increasingly seen as an invaluable asset, and are comfortable collaborating with HR subject matter experts to understand the business requirements.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO, CAN-QC-MONTRÉAL

Canada

Full time

item.title: Senior Manager, Advanced Analytics and Modeling
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Advanced Analytics and Modeling

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In the role of Senior Manager, Advanced Analytics and Modeling you will leverage your deep knowledge of Credit Risk methodologies, advanced analytics and modeling to drive innovation for Private Banking Credit. You will work collaboratively with Private Banking Senior Management, Group Risk Management, Products, and other Enterprise groups to understand, develop and ensure successful implementation of predictive models. You will solve complex business problems by retrieving and analyzing large amounts of data, diving deep to identify business insights and opportunities, design simulations, developing statistical and machine learning models by tailoring to business needs, and collaborating with key stakeholders across the enterprise.

What will you do?

  • Develop and implement sophisticated predictive and decision making models  to enhance the effectiveness & efficiency of credit delivery including scoring, decision making, and pre or conditional approving
  • Apply statistical and machine learning techniques to specific business problems and data
  • Retrieve, synthesize, and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answering specific business matters
  • Analyze historical data to identify trends and support optimal decision making
  • Conduct written and verbal presentations to share insights to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication
  • Establish credibility by quickly acquiring and demonstrating subject matter expertise and deep knowledge in Private Banking business and Credit methodologies
  • Contribute to the unique culture of Private Banking group by continually demonstrating commitment to coach and develop the team and grow the professional capabilities of the group and yourself

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Degree in quantitative field of study (e.g. Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science) 
  • Strong knowledge on retail and wholesale credit risk, economic capital, and risk simulation
  • Strong coding skills (python, SQL, and SAS), with experience in implementing automation in the server environment.
  • 5+ years’ experience in advance data modeling, predictive analytics; ML and AI

Nice to Have 

  • Financial and business designations (e.g. CFA, CPA, Six Sigma)
  • Advanced technical skills in developing Dashboards using Tableau
  • Strong understanding and experience of High Net Worth Client Segment and Private Banking

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.title: Senior Manager, HEF Analytics & Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, HEF Analytics & Reporting

Job Description

RBC Home Equity Financing is the leading lender of residential mortgages in Canada, and RBC’s single largest business with over ~$400 Billion in balances.  The business has grown significantly over the last 5+ years, driven by our flagship Homeline Plan product, innovative marketing efforts, and wide distribution network.  In order to maintain our leadership position, will require a strong commitment to product innovation, client retention, and effective use of multiple channels to acquire and retain clients; in addition to a significant focus on portfolio optimization and cost reduction.

What is the Opportunity?

We are looking for an individual who is enthusiastic and thoughtful about using data to help monitor the Home Equity Financing business’s performance and client base. The candidate will bring creativity and an inquisitive mind-set as they work with colleagues and partners to reconcile different data sources and identify creative ways to achieve client and portfolio analytics & reporting.

The candidate will play an integral role and is responsible for creating a data driven approach to ensuring we are connecting with 1MM+ of our home equity clients during the longest journey of their mortgage – between acquisition and renewal. In addition, the candidate will play an instrumental role in producing regular reporting for our regulators (OSFI and Bank of Canada) on the performance of the Home Equity and Financing.

What will you do?

Client Engagement Analytics & Reporting

  • Responsible for developing a client centric and data driven approach to segmenting our 1MM+ Home Equity Financing clients in order to engage these clients with personalized treatment plans to reduce mid-term attrition
  • Provide support as a RBC data lead in the development of a home owner engagement platform with our RBC Ventures partners through identifying and sourcing RBC data to the engagement platform
  • Create reporting to track, monitor and report the success of client engagement tactics with our Home Equity Financing clients

Regulatory and Portfolio Analytics &Reporting

  • Collaborate with partners across RBC and conduct portfolio monitoring reports for HEF business to our regulators (e.g. BOC, OSFI)
  • Support new report/methodology development as requested by regulators and conduct user acceptance test (UAT) for new development
  • Work collaboratively and advise on business decisions through use of reporting and analytics and provide insights from the data to support RBC responses to our regulators (i.e. FCAC, OSFI, BoC) and other data initiatives.
  • Participate in high-priority initiatives required to support the HEF and PFP senior management teams, including creation of data governance model, preparation of “canned” reports, standardization of reports, creation and testing of new reports for Shared Financial Services group
  • Identify ways to continuously improve and drive efficiencies in report creation for our regulators

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Ability to think strategically, integrate information from multiple sources and synthesize complex issues
  • Impact and influence of others through thought leadership and effective communication skills
  • Proficient in use of SAS, SQL, Excel, and RBC based account platforms (Casper, Linx, etc)

Nice-to-have

  • Experience automating and finding efficient ways to produce regular reports
  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field is preferred but not required (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.)
  • Previous experience in Finance Role (Accounting) or Home Equity Financing or dealing with regulators

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Cyber data analytics and development (GCS)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Cyber data analytics and development (GCS)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Be part of a dynamic group which help develop and maintain data monitors services around user behavioral risks using advanced data modelling techniques to highlight and then minimize identified exposures. The data protection team utilize in-house built services and continuously enhance and expand data modelling for ongoing insights to help investigation outcomes.

What will you do?

  • Assemble and analyze large, complex data sets that meet business and team requirements.
  • Build and maintain data pipelines from varied sources to enable complex management reporting.
  • Build, run and maintain python scripts for building reporting automation.
  • Model complex employee related behaviors using algorithmic, data mining, and visualization techniques
  • Leverage data driven insights and provide opinions on key risk indicators.
  • Identify key risk indicators to measure and contribute to the development of behavioral based rules and oversight.
  • Identify and address issues with policy compliance through analysis; monitoring and assessing cyber events.
  • Develops technology based tools and performs data analysis to monitor, measure, and manage discovered risks.
  • Implements monitoring to ensure discovered data risks are reviewed and actioned.
  • Develop action plans to resolve issues and re-designs processes to better manage, measure, and monitor exposure risks.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Experience with requirements gathering and documentation.
  • Experience with programming and scripting languages using Python and SQL as a primary data store.
  • Understanding of data management practices (manipulating, processing and extracting large, disconnected datasets) and managing data pipelines using analytics service ex.  Dataiku, Python and API based services.
  • Experience with web application development, application event analysis and API integrations.
  • Knowledge of cyber security standards, risks, threats, protection measures, and industry best practices in a financial regulatory space.
  • Experience providing operational support, issue identification and remediation in complex environments.

Nice-to-have

  • Development experience using other programming languages and or frameworks.
  • Extensive experience with data science and modelling.
  • Industry security related training and certifications.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Work on and influence data protection services which are the core of decision making and ongoing risk management practices.
  • Develop and manage future proof services with strong links to data science practices and outcomes.
  • Ability to embrace the art of the possible in everyday work. 
    • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, and competitive compensation.
    • Work with leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
    • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
    • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
    • Flexible work/life balance options.
    • Opportunities to do challenging work.
    • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.         
    • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies.

Job Summary

Monitors data usage risks and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any exposure of data. Apply advanced analytical and development skills to highlight and action key risks using modelling and programmatic solutions.
